name: Keeping Batman Busy Multiple Choice Quiz | DC Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: I was once nicknamed "Apollo" for my good looks and have a history in law. Thanks to "Boss" Maroni, I left my wife and my previous life behind, but I just can't make decisions on my own! Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Two-Face.

	Harvey Dent is Two-Face, a physically and mentally disfigured villain who makes decisions using a coin. Although he is best known as a villain, he has worked with Batman several times, even serving as Gotham's protector for nearly a year.

questions.text: I live in the sewers of Gotham City, and I have uncanny strength! An experienced wrestler, I am also a cannibal. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Killer Croc.

	Killer Croc is really Waylon Jones, born with a medical condition that caused him to grow more and more reptilian in appearance. He has also lived in Louisiana, although he is most often found in Gotham.

questions.text: I was a famous actor before I began my life of crime. I can change into any shape, making me suitable for nearly all film roles, but crime is a lot more fun. I adopted the name of Clayface. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Basil Karlo.

	Karlo is one of at least four people to use the Clayface name, but he is the only one to have been an actor. In fact, he first turned to  crime when he heard of a remake of his most famous movie! (In the original animated series, Matt Hagen was an actor, but in the comics it is Karlo who is an actor.)

questions.text: Bang! I am a marksman of great skill: I don't ever miss my target! I'll do anything to win a fight, including shooting myself in the throat! Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Deadshot.

	Floyd Lawton is Dead shot, a villain who got his start in 1950 in Batman's comic book. While fighting Kyle Rayner, the Green Lantern, Dead shot shot himself in the throat in order to get the upper hand in the battle.

questions.text: Someone removed part of my brain! I'm not too smart, but when I take my medicine I am calm. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Amygdala.

	Aaron Helzinger is Amygdala, a victim of a botched brain surgery who is easily led. With super-strength, he has also been a sometimes ally of Nightwing, Dick Grayson.

questions.text: I only kill members of my own family, but I was killed by Jean-Paul Valley. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Abattoir.

	Abattoir is a serial killer who believed his family was evil. Jean-Paul Valley, who was acting as Batman at the time, confronted him in a refinery and let him fall to his death, but Abattoir made one last appearance as a ghost to haunt Bruce Wayne, who wasn't easily fazed/

questions.text: I am a technologically-enhanced villain who first infiltrated the Justice League by impersonating one of their members! I can access a dimension called "The Ghost Zone". Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Prometheus.

	Prometheus' origin mirrors that of Batman himself. Having seen his criminal parents gunned down before his eyes, Prometheus swore to eradicate all signs of justice. He traveled the world and learned many fighting techniques.

questions.text: I don't hate Batman so much as I hate Bruce Wayne! I hated my parents and I hold a grudge against Bruce for having such good fortune. I wrap my head in bandages. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Hush.

	Hush is Thomas Elliot, a childhood friend of Bruce Wayne. He has worked independently and with other villains to bring Batman down, but was later held prisoner by the Joker.

questions.text: There is one scar on my body for every person I've killed. Well, except that time I failed to kill Alfred Pennyworth. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Zsasz.

	Victor Zsasz sees himself as a mercy killer: life is meaningless, so  he "liberates" people by killing them. He was briefly seen in the movie "Batman Begins".

questions.text: I am the man who broke Batman! I was born and raised in prison, but I escaped and rely on an addictive drug for my superb strength! Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Bane.

	Bane was born in a South American prison, left to serve out his father's life sentence. He escaped and found his way to Gotham city, where he engineered a mass escape from Arkham Asylum to wear Batman down.
